author: garfreeek

text: Anyone else happy that Pokken is getting some good reviews so far?  Hopefully if Pokken gets enough support, we may have Nintendo's 2nd fighting game series.  Would love to see more playable Pokemon.
author: mas8705

text: +mas8705 Pokken might be one of the few games where I actually want to see some DLC coming. There are still sooo many Pokemon that would fit perfectly into the Roster!
author: Ropun

text: +Mr5thgen same.  My only problem is that for reasons I don't get, DLC is something that I don't think has been teased once during the production of this game.  Nintendo didn't hesitate to tease the idea of Smash having incoming DLC, but nothing was said for Pokken for some reason.
author: mas8705

text: Well, it is an arcade game, and i think there will be more characters, just to keep the game somewhat relevant...atleast i hope that

text: Well I'm glad Pokken has all those different audio sliders. Time to turn down everything except for music because I had NO IDEA THIS KIND OF WONDERFUL MUSIC WAS IN POKKEN. The only music I ever notice is Diggersby (which is a fantastic theme). Tim to adjust my volume settings!

author: Joey Ford

text: I'm very curious to play this game as a big fan of Tekken, my favorite 3D fighting series. I love when Nintendo lets other developers give a shot at one of their beloved franchises. The results are not always masterpieces, but they're certainly breaths of fresh air. That's how we get something like Pikachu Libre. Edit: Or not!
author: SupraDarky

text: Actually, if my memory serves correctly, I do believe that Pikachu Libre actually was in Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire as one of Cosplay Pikachu's costumes.
